intro: Chloraea semibarbata subsp. pearcei, commonly known as the pearce's chloraea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are typically opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are usually pale green to white, with five petals and a distinctive calyx. This subspecies is often found in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats.
